text.*:
The Fortress
Theatrical release poster
Hangul 남한산성
Hanja 南漢山城
Revised Romanization Namhan sanseong
McCune–Reischauer Namhan sanŏng
Directed by Hwang Dong-hyuk
Screenplay by Hwang Dong-hyuk
Based on Namhansanseong
by Kim Hoon
Starring Lee Byung-hun
Kim Yoon-seok
Music by Ryuichi Sakamoto
Cinematography Kim Jee-yong
Edited by Nam Na-yeong
Distributed by CJ Entertainment
Release date
  • October 3, 2017 (2017-10-03)
Running time
 139 minutes
Country South Korea
Language Korean
Manchu
Box office US$29.2 million[1]

The Fortress is a 2017 South Korean historical drama film directed by Hwang Dong-hyuk, starring Lee Byung-hun and Kim Yoon-seok. It is based on the novel Namhansanseong by Kim Hoon.[2][3][4][5][6][7][8][9]

Contents

  • 1 Plot
  • 2 Cast
    • 2.1 Main
    • 2.2 Supporting
  • 3 Release and reception
  • 4 Awards and nominations
  • 5 References
  • 6 External links

Plot[edit]

Based on the Second Manchu invasion of Korea in 1636, where King Injo and his retainers sought refuge in the fortress located in Namhansanseong.

Cast[edit]

Main[edit]

  • Lee Byung-hun as Choi Myung-kil

A leader of one of the two ideological cliques that battles in the fortress trying to decide whether to make peace or fight against the Qing dynasty.[10][11]

  • Kim Yoon-seok as Kim Sang-hun[12]

The other leader of the ideological clique who battles with Choi's opinion and firmly believes in defending the nation's dignity by fighting against the Qing dynasty.[13]

  • Park Hae-il as King Injo

The king who is in agony in the tense conflicts between his men over the fate of the nation.[14]

  • Go Soo as Seo Nal-soi

A blacksmith sent out with a king's letter to recruit loyal forces.

  • Park Hee-soon as Lee Shi-baek

The chief of the Joseon military who silently defends the mountain fortress in the extreme cold weather conditions.

Supporting[edit]

  • Song Young-chang as Kim Ryoo
  • Jo Woo-jin as Jung Myung-soo
  • Lee David as Chil-bok
  • Heo Sung-tae as Yong Gol-dae
  • Kim Beop-rae as Kan
  • Jo Ah-in as Na-roo
  • Jin Seon-kyu as Lee Doo-gap
  • Yoo Soon-woong as Chief Scholar
  • Park Ji-il as Deputy Chief Scholar
  • Choi Jong-ryul as Eunuch
  • Kim Joong-ki as Do Seung-ji
  • Shin Ki-joon as Crown Prince

Release and reception[edit]

The film was released in South Korean cinemas on October 3, 2017.[15] It topped the box office on its opening day with 444,527 viewers. According to the film's distributor CJ Entertainment, by the second day of its release, the film had accumulated more than one million admissions, the fastest film released during the Chuseok holidays to surpass the mark.[16][17]

The Fortress was sold to 28 countries worldwide including U.S.A, Japan, Taiwan and Singapore. It was the opening film at the 2nd London East Asia Film Festival. In South Korea, the film attracted a total of 3.8 million moviegoers.[18]
